content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on underclings below the triangular feature. Move up the triangular feature praying it doesnâ€™t break and move up to the top.
content.location: Goes up through the prominent triangular feature on the climber's left arete.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Starts on a protruding sidepull. Go up and right through some flakes and then top out.

If all of the holds on this one break except for the start hold you can still dyno to the top which goes around V0.
content.location: Starts on the side pulls to the right and below the prominent triangular feature.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start on the obvious wall features using a noticeable good foot at the base of the arete. Move slightly left up through the features and find the good jug at the top for an easy top out.
content.location: About halfway between the dihedral and the right arete.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Start slightly to the left of the arete with a right hand on the arete. Make your way right and up the arete.

You can jump down or climb down from the top of this route to get off of the top of the boulder if you don't want to down climb between the two rocks.
content.location: Goes up the arete on the climber's right side of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit Start, Top Out

Dihedral route. Start on the sidepull feature on the bottom left. Make a big move on iffy feet to a higher sidepull on the right. Get better feet for for a tricky top out.
content.location: Goes through the dihedral in the middle of the face.

content.description: Sit start matched on the undercling with a low hidden right foot directly below the undercling and a left foot on the flake features. Pull up to a small iron crimp and a left gaston in order to gain the lip to topout. Slightly contrived, but the jug holds on "Procrastination" are off.
content.location: This line follows the most featureless part of the Learning Boulder a few right of the dihedral in the center of the boulder.
